intro: Amicia parvula, commonly known as the small amicia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Amicia parvula is often found in moist, wooded areas and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
